00011   return new bpred_random_t();

00015 struct bpred_random_t:public bpred_dir_t
00016 {
00017   protected:
00018 
00019   counter_t num_taken;
00020 
00021   public:
00022 
00023   /* CREATE */
00024   bpred_random_t()
00025   {
00026     init();
00027 
00028     name = strdup(COMPONENT_NAME);
00029     if(!name)
00030       fatal("couldn't malloc random name (strdup)");
00031     type = strdup("completely random");
00032     if(!type)
00033       fatal("couldn't malloc random name (strdup)");
00034 
00035     bits = 0;
00036   }
00037 
00038   /* LOOKUP */
00039   BPRED_LOOKUP_HEADER
00040   {
00041     int pred = random()&1;
00042     BPRED_STAT(lookups++;)
00043     scvp->updated = false;
00044     return pred;
00045   }
00046 
00047   /* UPDATE */
00048   BPRED_UPDATE_HEADER
00049   {
00050     if(!scvp->updated)
00051     {
00052       if(outcome)
00053         BPRED_STAT(num_taken++;)
00054       BPRED_STAT(updates++;)
00055       BPRED_STAT(num_hits += our_pred == outcome;)
00056       scvp->updated = true;
00057     }
00058   }
00059 
00060   /* REG_STATS */
00061   BPRED_REG_STATS_HEADER
00062   {
00063     bpred_dir_t::reg_stats(sdb,core);
00064 
00065     int id = core?core->current_thread->id:0;
00066     char buf[256];
00067     char buf2[256];
00068 
00069     sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.num_taken",id,name);
00070     sprintf(buf2,"number of taken branch predictions by %s",name);
00071     stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_taken, num_taken, NULL);
00072   }
00073 
00074   /* RESET_STATS */
00075   BPRED_RESET_STATS_HEADER
00076   {
00077     bpred_dir_t::reset_stats();
00078     num_taken = 0;
00079   }
00080 
00081 };
